alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 10:54PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and poor-drainage flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1051 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause flooding or urban and other poorly-drained areas. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area through the next two to three hours. Hydroplaning is also expected to be a widespread hazard this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Westbrook, Kittery, Bath and Alfred.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
